results.adx_keywords: Deaths (Obituaries);Actors and Actresses;Theater;Movies;Politics and Government;Jackson, Glenda;Labour Party (Great Britain);Great Britain
results.title: Glenda Jackson, Oscar-Winning Actress Turned Politician, Dies at 87
results.abstract: She walked away from a successful acting career to enter the British Parliament, before returning to the stage as the title character in an acclaimed “King Lear.”

media.caption: Glenda Jackson in Ken Russell’s film “Women in Love,” from 1969. Her performance brought her first of two Oscars for best actress.

results.adx_keywords: Women and Girls;Children and Childhood;Transgender;Discrimination;Athletics and Sports;British Columbia (Canada);Canada
results.title: Man Who Questioned 9-Year-Old Athlete’s Gender Spurs Outrage
results.abstract: A track and field event in British Columbia has engendered debate about transphobia in Canada.

media.caption: A track and field meet for elementary students held last week in Kelowna, British Columbia, where a man questioned a 9-year-old girl’s gender.

results.adx_keywords: Deaths (Obituaries);Books and Literature;Book Trade and Publishing;Gottlieb, Robert;Knopf, Alfred A, Inc;Simon & Schuster Inc;New Yorker
results.title: Robert Gottlieb, Eminent Editor From le Carré to Clinton, Dies at 92
results.abstract: At Simon & Schuster, Alfred A. Knopf and The New Yorker, he polished the work of a who’s who of mid-to-late 20th century writers.

media.caption: Robert Gottlieb at his home in Manhattan in 2016. He turned hundreds of manuscripts into well-received books, many of which sold millions of copies, won awards and made authors wealthy and famous.
media.copyright: George Etheredge for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Federal Criminal Case Against Trump (Documents Case);Classified Information and State Secrets;United States Politics and Government;Trump, Donald J;National Archives and Records Administration;Justice Department;Mar-a-Lago (Palm Beach, Fla)
results.byline: By Maggie Haberman, Alan Feuer and Michael S. Schmidt
results.title: At the Heart of the Documents Case: Trump’s Attachment to His Boxes
results.abstract: The former president has long stowed papers and odds and ends in cartons that he liked to keep close. His aides have called it the “beautiful mind” material.
des_facet: Federal Criminal Case Against Trump (Documents Case)

media.caption: Former President Donald J. Trump’s attachment to the contents of the boxes has left him in serious legal peril.

results.title: In Miami, the Only Violence From Trump Supporters Was Rhetorical
results.abstract: Calls for retribution were plentiful after the former president’s indictments, but the demonstrations proved tame, a possible result of the aggressive prosecution of the Jan. 6 rioters.
des_facet: Federal Criminal Case Against Trump (Documents Case)

media.caption: Despite calls for protests, the crowds were relatively tame and small outside former President Donald J. Trump’s arraignment in Miami on Tuesday.

results.adx_keywords: Sex Crimes;Drug Abuse and Traffic;Instagram Inc;Las Vegas (Nev)
results.title: Finance Executive Accused of Drugging and Raping Teen in Midtown Hotel
results.abstract: Michael Olson, 54, flew the girl around the country, passing her off as his daughter, prosecutors said. He kept spreadsheets of children he contacted, they said.

media.caption: Prosecutors said the girl was overdosing on cocaine and ketamine when she was found. There may be more victims.

results.adx_keywords: Weddings and Engagements;Marriages;Sex;internal-sub-only
results.title: What Wedding Night Sex?
results.abstract: If you fell asleep on the big night, don’t worry. So did many other (still) happily married couples.

results.title: Supreme Court Upholds Native American Adoption Law
results.abstract: At issue in the case was whether a law aimed at keeping Native American adoptees within tribes is constitutional.

media.caption: Nita Battise, a member of the Alabama-Coushatta tribe, celebrated the ruling on the steps of the Supreme Court on Thursday.

results.byline: By Jonathan Swan, Charlie Savage and Maggie Haberman
results.title: The Radical Strategy Behind Trump’s Promise to ‘Go After’ Biden
results.abstract: Conservatives with close ties to Donald J. Trump are laying out a “paradigm-shifting” legal rationale to erase the Justice Department’s independence from the president.
des_facet: Federal Criminal Case Against Trump (Documents Case)

media.caption: “I will totally obliterate the Deep State,” Donald Trump said on Tuesday evening at an event at his club in Bedminster, N.J., hours after his arraignment on federal charges.

results.title: The Plan to Save New York From the Next Sandy Will Ruin the Waterfront. It Doesn’t Have To.
results.abstract: The Army Corps’s plan to protect New York from flooding relies too heavily on walls.

results.byline: By Michael S. Schmidt and Charlie Savage
results.title: Judge in Trump Documents Case Has Scant Criminal Trial Experience
results.abstract: Judge Aileen M. Cannon, under scrutiny for past rulings favoring the former president, has presided over only a few criminal cases that went to trial.
des_facet: Federal Criminal Case Against Trump (Documents Case)

media.caption: Judge Aileen M. Cannon, 42, has been on the bench since November 2020, when President Donald J. Trump gave her a lifetime appointment shortly after he lost re-election.

results.adx_keywords: Shopping Centers and Malls;Real Estate (Commercial);Shopping and Retail;Renting and Leasing (Real Estate);CUSHMAN & WAKEFIELD INC;Westfield Corp;San Francisco (Calif)
results.byline: By Jordyn Holman and Thomas Fuller
results.title: Westfield Gives Up San Francisco Mall, Signaling More Pain Ahead
results.abstract: Retailers have been fleeing the city’s downtown, and some analysts say there may be more to come. It’s an issue facing various downtowns around the United States.

media.caption: Westfield, which has owned the downtown San Francisco Centre mall since 2002, said this week that it was handing it back to its lender. The mall is expected to be 45 percent empty when Nordstrom departs this summer.
media.copyright: Jason Henry for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Suits and Litigation (Civil);Computers and the Internet;Search Engines;Identity Theft;Privacy;Corporations;Content Type: Service;Alphabet Inc;Google Inc
results.title: Google Might Owe You Money. Here’s How to Get It.
results.abstract: As part of a legal settlement, Google agreed to pay $23 million to users who clicked on a search link from 2006 to 2013. Individual payments are estimated to be less than $8.

media.caption: Sundar Pichai, the chief executive of Alphabet Inc., in May. Google, which is owned by Alphabet, has agreed to settle a class-action lawsuit that accused it of sharing search details with third-party sites.
media.copyright: Jason Henry for The New York Times

results.byline: By Ruth Graham and Elizabeth Dias
results.title: Southern Baptists Vote to Further Expand Restrictions on Women as Leaders
results.abstract: Delegates at the denomination’s convention approved a stricter ban on female pastors and rejected the appeals of two churches led by women to remain in the denomination.

media.caption: Linda Barnes Popham, the pastor of Fern Creek Baptist Church, held up a Bible as she appealed the Southern Baptist Convention’s decision to expel her church from the denomination.
media.copyright: Christiana Botic for The New York Times

results.title: Harvard Medical School Morgue Manager Sold Body Parts, U.S. Says
results.abstract: Federal prosecutors said the manager was one of seven people charged with being part of a network that bought and sold remains stolen from the medical school and an Arkansas mortuary.

media.caption: A nationwide network bought and sold human remains stolen from Harvard Medical School and a mortuary in Little Rock, Ark., prosecutors said.

results.title: Oregon Town’s Marijuana Boom Yields Envy in Idaho

results.title: They Said What? Lip Readers Decode Celebrity Whispers
results.abstract: There are millions of views to be had for those who can interpret the caught-on-camera conversations of royal family members, Taylor Swift, and Ben and Jennifer Affleck.

media.caption: Ben and Jennifer Affleck at the Los Angeles premiere last month for “The Mother.”
